wikipedia_page.main:
Charles Thurston Thompson (1816-1868) was an early British photographer. 
Thompson is credited with having taken the first ever photograph of a photographic exhibition, in his capacity as the official photographer of the South Kensington Museum, now known as the Victoria and Albert Museum. In 1858 he photographed the Raphael Cartoons of the Royal Collection.His work is included in the collections of the Victoria and Albert Museum, the Museum of Modern Art, New York, the Getty Museum, the National Gallery of Art, Washington and the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
